name: Digital Transformation Agency
aiTransparencyStatement: DTA is introducing a structured AI-assisted evaluation model to assist with the Digital Marketplace Panel 2 evaluation process. Currently uses Microsoft 365 Copilot for workplace productivity.
aiUsageDisclosure: AI tools leverage generative AI to help automate repetitive tasks, summarize documents, generate emails and reports, and assist with data analysis.

name: Australian Taxation Office
aiTransparencyStatement: The ATO uses data and analytics (D&A), including automation and AI, which helps administer the tax and superannuation systems more effectively. Only uses AI in ways that maintain security, privacy, transparency and ethical use of data.
aiUsageDisclosure: AI models prompt individuals completing their tax return online through myTax to help them get it right. However, recent ANAO audit found concerns about insufficient integration of ethical and legal considerations.
auditFindings: ANAO audit revealed ATO has not sufficiently integrated ethical and legal considerations into AI model design and development.

name: Australian Securities and Investments Commission
aiTransparencyStatement: ASIC is committed to safe, responsible, and transparent use of AI and will comply with applicable laws and regulation.

name: Administrative Review Tribunal
aiTransparencyStatement: Has published a statement complying with DTA requirements.

name: Australian Bureau of Statistics
aiTransparencyStatement: Transparency statement published to website on 16th July 2025, updated every 12 months or as their approach to AI changes.

name: Department of Health, Disability and Ageing
aiTransparencyStatement: Published AI transparency statement outlining commitment to responsible AI use.

name: Department of Home Affairs
aiTransparencyStatement: Published transparency statement in February 2025.

name: Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade
aiTransparencyStatement: DFAT requires all staff to undertake training on the appropriate use of AI prior to enabling their access.

name: Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation
aiTransparencyStatement: CSIRO conducts responsible AI research for Australia's benefit. Statement explains how they use AI responsibly and ethically, outlining their principles, governance, and commitment to transparency, safety and continuous improvement.
aiUsageDisclosure: AI is used extensively in research projects across all domains.

name: Department of Education
aiTransparencyStatement: Has an AI transparency statement last updated 30/09/2025.

name: Department of Agriculture, Fisheries and Forestry
aiTransparencyStatement: Does not currently use AI in any way that directly interacts with the public without a human intermediary or intervention.

name: Department of the Treasury
aiTransparencyStatement: Provides details of Treasury's implementation of policy requirements relating to accountable officials and transparency statements.

name: Attorney-General's Department
aiTransparencyStatement: Outlines the department's commitment to responsible AI use, detailing technologies, governance, data privacy, and continuous improvement in alignment with government policies on AI transparency and ethics.

name: Department of Finance
aiTransparencyStatement: Published AI transparency statement in accordance with government policy.

name: Services Australia
aiTransparencyStatement: Committed to ensuring use of automation and AI is human-centric, safe, responsible, transparent, fair, ethical and legal. Aligns with Australia's AI Ethics Principles and National framework for the assurance of AI in government.
aiUsageDisclosure: Uses automation to improve efficiency of government service delivery. Do NOT use AI to process claims. Human oversight of AI in compliance, auditing and decision-making processes.

name: Department of Social Services
aiTransparencyStatement: Published AI transparency statement discussing commitment to policy requirements and ethical use of AI.

name: Australian Prudential Regulation Authority
aiTransparencyStatement: Has an AI Transparency Statement in accordance with DTA's Policy for responsible use of AI in government.

name: Australian Competition and Consumer Commission
aiTransparencyStatement: Published AI transparency statement outlining how they intend to use AI, what they use it for, and how they'll monitor its usage.

name: Australian Transaction Reports and Analysis Centre
aiTransparencyStatement: Published Artificial Intelligence Transparency Statement.

name: Department of Industry, Science and Resources
aiTransparencyStatement: Published artificial intelligence transparency statement.

name: National Archives of Australia
aiTransparencyStatement: Published AI transparency statement.

name: eSafety Commissioner
aiTransparencyStatement: Published AI transparency statement.

name: Fair Work Commission
aiTransparencyStatement: The Commission will not use generative AI to make decisions under the Fair Work Act 2009. Has established an AI Assessment Committee (AIAC) to provide oversight.
aiUsageDisclosure: May develop generative AI tools that the public can interact with in future to enhance service delivery.

name: Fair Work Ombudsman
aiTransparencyStatement: Published AI transparency statement in February 2025.

name: Productivity Commission
aiTransparencyStatement: Outlines their approach to AI adoption and use in accordance with DTA's policy on responsible use of AI in government.

name: National Indigenous Australians Agency
aiTransparencyStatement: Discusses the agency's commitment to policy requirements and ethical use of AI to enhance public services for Indigenous Australians, ensuring transparency, accountability, and inclusivity.
aiUsageDisclosure: Considering trialling adoption of AI as part of Australian Government's commitment to digital innovation through technical partnership with PM&C.

name: Clean Energy Regulator
aiTransparencyStatement: Committed to using technology, including AI, to enhance capability to be an efficient and effective economic regulator. Don't currently use AI in services or advice they provide.
aiUsageDisclosure: Will consider AI use to provide analytics for and insights into the schemes they regulate.

name: Australian National Audit Office
aiTransparencyStatement: Does not use AI tools that interact directly with the public and considers current AI use to have a low impact on the public. Exploring how generative AI can enhance the audit process.
aiUsageDisclosure: Uses three enterprise applications with AI: Nuix (eDiscovery), Adobe Acrobat (auto form-filling), and another tool. Trialing Microsoft Copilot.

name: Great Barrier Reef Marine Park Authority
aiTransparencyStatement: Not currently using AI across any of its domains. Any future uses would be documented in future iterations of the AI Transparency Statement.

name: IP Australia
aiTransparencyStatement: Uses AI to support the achievement of their purpose and strategic objectives. Committed to continuous improvement and recognises AI is becoming increasingly important to foster innovation in stewardship of the IP rights system.

name: NDIS Quality and Safeguards Commission
aiTransparencyStatement: Currently does not use AI in services or advice they provide externally or internally.

name: Australian Federal Police
aiTransparencyStatement: Strengthening responsible AI practices by releasing a transparency statement in accordance with the policy for responsible use of AI in government.

name: Office of the Special Investigator
aiTransparencyStatement: Receives IT services from AGD and AFP under shared services agreements. Uses AI in line with the AI policies of AGD and AFP.

name: Australian Research Council
aiTransparencyStatement: First published in April 2025. Statement reviewed annually, or when significant change is made to the ARC's approach to AI.

name: Comcare
aiTransparencyStatement: Outlines commitment to the safe, ethical and responsible use of AI. Published in February 2025.

name: Safe Work Australia
aiTransparencyStatement: First published to website on 28 February 2025. Will be reviewed annually or when significant changes occur.

name: Commonwealth Grants Commission
aiTransparencyStatement: Published AI transparency statement.

name: Commonwealth Ombudsman
aiTransparencyStatement: Published AI transparency statement.

name: Parliamentary Budget Office
aiTransparencyStatement: Published AI transparency statement.

name: Tertiary Education Quality and Standards Agency
aiTransparencyStatement: Published AI transparency statement.

name: Commonwealth Director of Public Prosecutions
aiTransparencyStatement: Published AI transparency statement.

name: Department of Infrastructure, Transport, Regional Development, Communications and the Arts
aiTransparencyStatement: Published Artificial Intelligence Transparency Statement.

name: Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water
aiTransparencyStatement: Published Artificial Intelligence Transparency Statement.

name: Department of Veterans' Affairs
aiTransparencyStatement: First published in February 2025. Accessing Commonwealth GovAI environment to evaluate potential AI tools to speed up claims processing. Statement reviewed annually or when significant changes occur.
aiUsageDisclosure: Testing on GovAI platform does not use veteran personal data. Small-scale pilots including Microsoft Copilot trial and proof-of-concept claims tool being used to test whether generative AI can simplify navigation and speed claims work.

name: National Health and Medical Research Council
aiTransparencyStatement: Published AI transparency statement.

name: Australian Institute of Criminology
aiTransparencyStatement: Published AI transparency statement.

name: Parliament of Australia - Department of the Senate
aiTransparencyStatement: Published AI transparency statement.

name: Australian Communications and Media Authority
aiTransparencyStatement: First published in February 2025. Transparent in internal use of AI technology as they explore, evaluate and adopt AI. Currently does not plan to use AI in services that the public may directly interact with.
aiUsageDisclosure: Has developed overarching agency approach to AI and established an AI Steering Committee. Generative AI tools must not be used unless specifically approved under robust approval, assurance and evaluation process and staff have undertaken AI training.

name: National Disability Insurance Agency
aiTransparencyStatement: Yet to publish an AI transparency statement. Has not voluntarily published like some other exempt agencies.

name: Office of the Australian Information Commissioner
aiTransparencyStatement: Provides guidance on privacy implications of AI systems.
